p: Carotenoids naturally exist in different isomers; obviously, the majority of the carotenoids happen in trans‐isomers in vegetative source. Nevertheless, rise in cis‐isomers attributed to food processing conditions (Schieber & Carle, 2005). Many authors, Mertz, Brat, Caris‐Veyrat, and Gunata ( 2010), Shi et al. ( 2010), and Zepka and Mercadante ( 2009) reported the different isomers in the dietary carotenoids, whereas some researchers are focused on geometric isomerization of carotenoids (Niedzwiedzki, Enriquez, Lafountain, & Frank, 2010; Qiu, Chen, & Li, 2009).
